titleStmt.title: Folly plainly made manifest, by an extravagant husband I sing his kind advice to all, of high or low degree, least they in poverty do fall, and bring themselves to misery· To the tune of, I have a mistris of my own.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for I[onah]. Deacon, at the Angel in Guiltspur-street.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Bad husbands now I pray draw near ..."
Place, date of publication, and publisher's name from Wing.
Reproduction of original in the Harvard University, Houghton Library.
